artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Jesus bound at R within a small mob of men raising weapons; a man in priestly clothing at L faces the group, elevating a bushy object in his PR hand; smaller man at LL holding a large basket
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate in tablet at top: [WER WIDER DIE ROMIS / C[...]N DER SOL STERBE]

inscribed in plate at bottom: [Lo Caiphas heere, while Christ before him standes / the Frier-like Ieues, with Inkhorners in their handes / and holy water, while a Card\'nall leades / Our Saviour pinion\'d with apaire of Beades,] 

numbered in plate at lower right: [5]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Christ before Caiaphas, From the Satirical Passion
